input_text:
Job Title: Multifamily Development Analyst

Location: Austin, Texas Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Research

Description:
Endeavor Real Estate Group - Greater focus, greater value.
At Endeavor, we’ve built our continued success on a simple formula. Approach every relationship with integrity and treat every project like it’s in our own backyard. With this formula, we’ve grown steadily since 1999, through some of history’s most turbulent market conditions. It’s the foundation for projects that are builtto last, and for a company dedicated to the needs of property owners, investors, tenants, and the community. It’s doing the right thing, for the right reasons. It’s our Endeavor.
Job SummaryThe Multifamily Development Analyst performs complex investment due diligence and analysis. This involves assisting the Endeavor Multifamily division from initial site analysis and underwriting through project capitalization, construction, lease-up, and project disposition. This position will report directly to Endeavor’s Multifamily Principals and work closely with all members of Endeavor’s Multifamily division.
Experience/Education2+ years of financial analysis experience in a multifamily, development or private equity company with multifamily focus preferredBS/BA degree in Finance, Economics, or related field
Start DateImmediate/near-term start
Essential Job Functions and ResponsibilitiesPerform financial analysis of ground-up multifamily development and mixed-use projects that contain various real estate components (multifamily, retail, office, etc.) Support in the site due diligence and underwriting analysis process. Gather, compile, investigate, and analyze market data to identify potential investment and development opportunities.Assist in the debt and equity raising process (assemble packages, research market data, manage lender and investor correspondence, etc.)Support in all multifamily transaction processes (purchases, sales, construction loan closings, etc.)Prepare presentation materials for Investment Committee, investor presentations, and other meetings.Analyze financial and economic information from various sources to forecast business, industry, and economic conditions.Value existing real estate assets based on analyzing historical operating and financial performance.Assist in corporate accounting and legal efforts related to new multifamily pursuits and existing operating properties. Update various asset management schedules, portfolio-level reports, and other investor or corporate reports.Assist in corporate and non-role-specific functions as needed with a “team player” mentality. 
 Financial SkillsUnderstand mathematical concepts including net present value (“NPV”), levered and unlevered internal rate of return (“IRR”), cash on cash return, yield on cost (“YOC”), and all basic concepts associated with real estate finance. Extensive experience in financial modeling in Excel and the review of financial statements related to multifamily operations. Interpret an extensivevariety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. 
Technical SkillsSuperior Excel, PowerPoint, and Word skills requiredProficient Adobe Suite skills suggested
Personal SkillsSelf-starter who thrives in entrepreneurial environmentsStrong organizational and project management skillsDeadline driven and able to prioritizeAcute attention to detailExcellent writing and editing skills
Work with the largest real estate developer and service provider in central Texas. Endeavor Real Estate Group is a growing company offering a professional, innovative, and collaborative work environment.

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Multifamily Development Analyst
output_json.summary: Endeavor Real Estate Group seeks a Multifamily Development Analyst to perform complex investment due diligence and analysis.
preferred_degrees: BS/BA degree in Finance, Economics, or related field

Support in the site due diligence and underwriting analysis process
Gather, compile, investigate, and analyze market data
Assist in the debt and equity raising process
Support in all multifamily transaction processes
Forecast business, industry, and economic conditions
Assist in corporate accounting and legal efforts
Update various asset management schedules and portfolio-level reports
Assist in corporate and non-role-specific functions
